prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions: Construct a rectangular prism Step 1: Create the coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 Step 2: Create the 2D sketch - Face: Draw a sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.4312, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.4312, 0.0], End Point [0.4312, 0.75] - Line 3: Start Point [0.4312, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch with a scaling factor of 0.75. Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the given coordinate system parameters. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch with the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.0196 - Sketch scale: 0.75 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - The resulting shape will be a rectangular prism with: - Length: 0.0196 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.75 Final Shape Instructions Construct the final shape by following the instructions for the parts above. The final shape will be a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, where the sides are parallel, and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal, and the height is half the length of the sides: - Height: The height is half the length of the sides, 0.375. - Length: 0.0196. - Width: 0.75.</description>
